intro: Micromeria echioides var. strigosa, commonly known as the hairy micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flower heads. The plant has hairy, linear leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
